intro: Trochiscanthes, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Africa and consists of several species, many of which are shrubs or small trees. The plants are characterized by their palmate leaves and showy, yellow or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. They often grow in dry, sandy soils and are adapted to arid environments. The genus is of interest in botany due to its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations.
